extendedIngredients.name: grape seed oil
extendedIngredients.original: 1/4 cup plus 1 tablespoon grape seed oil, divided

extendedIngredients.name: pumpkin
extendedIngredients.original: 10 cups pumpkin, peeled, seeded, cut into large pieces
extendedIngredients.originalName: pumpkin, peeled, seeded, cut into large pieces

extendedIngredients.name: thyme sprigs
extendedIngredients.original: 1 sachet of 6 sprigs thyme, 6 sprigs parsley, 1 bay leaf and 8 black peppercorns
extendedIngredients.originalName: sachet of 6 sprigs thyme, 6 sprigs parsley, 1 bay leaf and 8 black peppercorns

extendedIngredients.name: white wine
extendedIngredients.original: 1 cup white wine (substitute with vegetable stock, if you wish)
extendedIngredients.originalName: white wine (substitute with vegetable stock, if you wish)
meta: with vegetable stock, if you wish)

title: Healthy Vegetarian Pumpkin Soup
summary: Healthy Vegetarian Pumpkin Soup might be just the soup you are searching for. One serving contains 135 calories, 2g of protein, and 7g of fat. This recipe serves 8. For $1.4 per serving, this recipe covers 10% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. It can be enjoyed any time, but it is especially good for Autumn. Head to the store and pick up vegetable stock, pumpkin, wine, and a few other things to make it today. It is a good option if you're following a gluten free and vegan diet. 1 person has tried and liked this recipe. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 1 hour and 30 minutes. With a spoonacular score of 49%, this dish is solid. Try Healthy Light Vegetable Soup: [Vegetarian & Gluten Free], Healthy Mushroom, Orzo & Swiss Chard Soup {Vegetarian} & Marathon Update, and 8 Healthy Pumpkin Soup s for similar recipes.
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.In a large bowl, toss the large pumpkin pieces with just enough grape seed oil (approximately 1/4 cup) to coat and place on a baking sheet into the oven.Roast the pumpkin until very tender, approximately 15-20 minutes. Cool and reserve.In a large stock pot, saut the shallots, celery, and garlic in a tablespoon of grape seed oil for 5 minutes.Deglaze with the white wine (or vegetable stock) and reduce the liquid by half.Add the roasted pumpkin, vegetable stock and sachet and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to a simmer and cook for 30 minutes.Remove the sachet, and puree the soup in a blender, food processor or with an immersion (wand) blender.Adjust the seasoning with salt and serve.

steps.step: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.In a large bowl, toss the large pumpkin pieces with just enough grape seed oil (approximately 1/4 cup) to coat and place on a baking sheet into the oven.Roast the pumpkin until very tender, approximately 15-20 minutes. Cool and reserve.In a large stock pot, saut the shallots, celery, and garlic in a tablespoon of grape seed oil for 5 minutes.Deglaze with the white wine (or vegetable stock) and reduce the liquid by half.
Add the roasted pumpkin, vegetable stock and sachet and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to a simmer and cook for 30 minutes.
Remove the sachet, and puree the soup in a blender, food processor or with an immersion (wand) blender.Adjust the seasoning with salt and serve.
